comment: For me, it's just about to begin...
got the last wee slice of pizza
Are you workin or just tired from being up late?
But tonight is cake and a film
Just finished Page 3 of 'Borrowed without Permission' too...I'm happy today! :D
Aaand I think I should get those Emoticons...just for funsies
Work is phasing out hazard pay
This is the last week of $2 extra per hour, and I missed a day because of family bs
Starting next week, it's $1 per hour, and then in October it'll finallly be gone
First of all, what did the hazard pay cover, and secondly, why is it going?
But, it shouldn't be going. Not yet.
At least my company kept it this long
And last time I checked, it is still around.
So many companies said "Oh well, fuck you" months ago
Yup, weird times ahead, no more training wheels on the economy kiddos
Ended their hazard pays either in May or June
I may have my gripes about my employer, but hazard pay wasn't one of them
...that was during the worst time of the crisis over here.
That's one thing going for them, I guess.
Some industries got pay cuts our high-earners lost 10-20% of pay
I luckily flew under the radar, not much other than a pat on the back for all the adapting so far though.
Lucilky we’re a small firm, so it’s relatively a tight0knit environment
I wonder how much nicer the world would be if we were a bit less miserly with our cash...all of us...
Because there are those who hoard and hoard it for its own sake
And others who barely have enough to buy food...if they have any at all.
The large companies hoarding cash and hiding it overseas is probably the most damaging. Large volumes limit overall money supply liquidity
WWhen everyone feels it’s hard to come by it’s probably because the big players are being stingy
That's the way it's always been, hasn't it?...The toffs at the top and the toshers at the bottom...
I mean, job wages haven’t exactly been generous, sure there are more people working but historically purse-strings are tighter
Big cos are always trying to limit costs
But it's too seldom for the benefit of their enterprises, and too often for their own [REDACTED] wallets...
A lot of it is emotion too, the bottom will spend and borrow more when they FEEL times are prosperous
LIke, the credit crises have shown us... not even half of that is actually their own money probably xD
Oh, I've known the feeling. It's terrible.
You have more than you've ever had, it might be a miniscule amount but a part of you cries out, 'I'M RICH', and fritters it away faster than a fox after a rabbit.
I feel like right now the high costs of things is making people feel ANY amount of money is small.
Houses, cars, goods, all are really at cycle-highs
So like any money the average folks make tends to feel not so significant rn.
...but then, at least in America, we have that sense of patriotism and WINNING that was happening in the mid 00’s.
I remember the end of the Celtic Tiger in Europe...that's what they called Ireland.
So people may begin to consume, depending if they can acquire debt or not, depending on what happens in the work economy and if everthing comes out of covid intact
Huge housing estates going up, little oversight on spending...some of them are ghost towns now, and the government is talking about social housing being in short supply..
Online shopping makes saving more difficult. I think that's a fact.
Yeah, right now houses are being built crazy and going crazy fast becase of low rates and because people are scared they might still lose jobs.
Best to be in a house already losing a job, at least you can live in it a bit lol
I am a little noodle with a little money nest :snake:
...can we please change the subject before the cynical depression engulfs us all?
Because right now I am biting down a rant.
The Wrath of Nibbly would be most welcome indeed as a distraction.
That's it, I'm getting the emotes
I want to make a Nibs train next sketch stream!
(I think I just proved my own point about impulse spending)
If I could just get a whole month off when this is all over, that'd be great...
In the post-covid future WFH you might be able to work from ANYWHERE
But then again, don't we lose something in the end?
There is a certain serenity to being able to seperate your work from your home.
'A man's home is his castle...but it shouldn't have to be his fortress'
Yeah, this experience has been weird
I think it relates to work as well.
tbh, some hipster cities have “shared-work spaces”
We shouldn't HAVE to do everything in our homes.
You like can go there to work it’s really just a giant empty, freelance office type thing
Kinda like how ppl use Starbucks but with out the coffee and more workspace amenities
I’m sure some have full kitchens or whatever to make coffee and get snacks
I’m sure there’s some sort of membership fee I would think maybe, maybe the city subsidizes it somewhat
Anyway, I'm going to shower and watch a film. I'll drop back by before I go to bed.
One I just looked up is like $129 a month
New Patreon Post: August Color Vote! https://www.patreon.com/posts/august-color-40948601
